SEARCH
Package ui

Class Main

java.lang.Object
ui.Main
public class Main extends Object
This Main class represents the main UI class for the Knowledge Capsule System. It contains the main method and all the user interface functionalities.

  • Constructor Details

    • Main

      public Main()
      This is the class constructor for the Main class. It initializes the scanner, controller, and date format objects, and sets the number of projects to zero.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This is the main method that starts the execution of the program. It creates an object of the Main class, displays the menu, and waits for user input. It executes the corresponding functionality based on the user's input until the user selects the "Exit" option. Finally, it closes the scanner object.
      Parameters:
      args - An array of String objects representing the command-line arguments.

    • menu

      public void menu()
      This method displays the main menu options for the user to select.

    • executeOption

      public void executeOption(int option)
      This method executes the corresponding functionality based on the user's input.
      Parameters:
      option - An integer representing the user's selected option.

    • validateIntegerInput

      public int validateIntegerInput()
      This method validates the user's input and returns the selected option as an integer.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the user's selected option.

    • addProject

      public void addProject()
      Reads user input to create a new project, and adds it to the project list in the KnowledgeCapsuleSystem class. Prints out the project details.

    • endStage

      public void endStage()
      Asks the user to enter the name of a project and then culminates the current stage of that project by invoking the 'culminateStage' method of the controller object. Displays the name of the current stage of the project before culminating it. If the project object does not exist, it catches the NullPointerException thrown by the 'findProjectByName' method and displays a message to the user.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the project object does not exist

    • addCapsule

      public void addCapsule()
      Adds a new capsule to the current stage of a project in the capsule management system. Prompts the user to enter the required information, such as the collaborator name, position, capsule type, description and learning. After validating the inputs, the method creates a new capsule and prints out the capsule's details, including its ID, type, status, description, lesson learned, collaborator name and position. If the project object does not exist, it catches the NullPointerException thrown by the 'findProjectByName' method and displays a message to the user.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the project object does not exist

    • hasHashtags

      public boolean hasHashtags(String str)
      Checks if a given string contains at least two hashtags.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to check for hashtags
      Returns:
      true if the string contains at least two hashtags, false otherwise

    • approveCapsule

      public void approveCapsule()
      Prompts the user to enter the name of a project and the ID of a capsule to approve. If the project exists, and the capsule belongs to the project and is in a state that allows approval, the capsule is approved and a success message is printed. If the project does not exist or the capsule cannot be approved, an error message is printed.

    • publishCapsule

      public void publishCapsule()
      Prompts the user to enter the name of a project and the ID of a capsule to publish. If the project exists, and the capsule belongs to the project and is in a state that allows publishing, the capsule is published and a success message is printed. If the project does not exist or the capsule cannot be published, an error message is printed.
